Vindelns folk-högsk. 20, e. q. lär. i Eskilstuna 21-25 o. vt 26, i Osl[:arshamn ht 26, i Skara 27-30, adj. i låtin o. franska v. Hvit-feldtska h. a. k i Gbg sed. 30. Hobby: trädg :skötsel.
translated:
Johansson, Nils Ivar, farmer, member of parliament, Mysinge, Östra Husby, born 28/8/99 in Norrköp. His father was a fitter and his parents were Nils Petter J. and Emilia Håkans. He married Sigrid Margareta Larsson in 1933, and they had three children: Ann-Marie born in 1934, Rolf born in 1935, and Ulfe born in 1939. Nils Ivar owned and cultivated Mysiinge farm since 1935. He was a member of the Parliament and a member of the Constitutional Committee from 1937-1940 and again from 1943. He was also a substitute in the First Legislative Committee in 1944, and in the State Budget Committee since 1945. Additionally, he was a member of the special committee of agriculture in 1944, the county council since 1939 and the vice-chairman in 1947. He was a member of the jury from 1941-1946. Nils Ivar was appointed as a substitute in the Board of Forestry for Östergötland County from 1941. He was a member of the housing company's executive committee from 1940, the Swedish Agricultural Credit Union, and the Östergötland Central Union since 1943. Furthermore, he was the chairman of the Vikboland Agricultural Association since 1942, a member of the Swedish Smallholder Farmers' Association's board for food supply in 1942, the chairman of the Östra Husby Dairy Association since 1931, a member of his own industry in the county since 1939, a member of the county's pig breeding committee since 1933, its chairman since 1938, a member of the party committee since 1947, a member of the board of directors of the Östergötland Land Management Central Association since 1940, a member of the Östra Husby municipal council since 1931, its chairman since 1943, a member of the taxation board since 1936, and a revenue controller since 1930. He was formerly the vice-chairman of Norrköping Local Association of the Farmers' League and a member of the county federation of the Farmers' League executive committee. He was also the vice-chairman of the Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences Östergötland district from 1946. 

Johanson, Ivar Isidor, senior high school teacher, Göteborg, born on //2/90 in Tjällmo, Östergötland, son of Gustaf Edvard J. and Augusta Stark. He married Olga Maria Möller in 1941, and they had three foster children: Bertil Möller born in 1920, who was a civil engineer in Gothenburg, Olle Möller born in 1922, who was a business economist in Mariannelund, and Sten Möller born in 1927, who was a student in Gothenburg. He obtained his high school diploma in Örebro in 1911, a Bachelor of Arts degree in Uppsala in 1916, studied for a degree in Philosophy in Uppsala from 1917-1919 and from 1920-1921; was a substitute teacher at the Northern Latin School in Stockholm in 1925; and traveled to France during the summers from 1923-1939 and to Germany, Austria, and Italy in summers 1938 and 1939 on state grants. He was a teacher at a private school from 1916-1917, a substitute teacher at the Vindeln Folk High School in 1920, a qualified teacher in Eskilstuna from 1921-1925 and in the spring semester of 1926, a teacher at Oskarshamn in the fall of 1926, and a teacher of Latin and French at Hvitfeldtska upper secondary school in Gothenburg since 1930. His hobby was gardening.
